item.title: Sam Hou Fai and Wu Sui
item.description: Everyone knows who Sam Hou Fai is, but Wu Sui, does anyone know who it is? I believe not only most Portuguese, but also many Chinese have never heard this name. However, in Chinese society, especially in Macao where popular beliefs are preserved, Wu Sui is an important figure because it is an “guardian deity” of the year of the serpent, responsible for supervising the happiness and misfortune of the human world. Wu Sui was born in China 800 years ago during the Song Dynasty and served as a magistrate in Xuning County. During his mandate, Wu Sui exposed many hidden crimes and the neighboring neighbors often sought their help and advice to solve difficult cases. One year, there was a great drought and Wu Sui prayed in the temple for three days and three nights and ended up raining. To relieve the drought's impact on the people, Wu decreed the tax reduction and the rental of the land, providing help to 48,000 victims of this disaster. At that time, more than 400,000 refugees from other affected areas crossed the river to Xiuning and Wu Sui did all possible to help them. While other cities were immersed in chaos due to incidents of agitation, set fire, and withdrawals motivated by drought, the areas governed by Wu Sui remained peaceful and orderly, without anyone creating any problem. Therefore, it is not without reason that popular tradition elected Wu as the guardian divinity in the year of the serpent. Due to the current complex and constantly changing international developments, it is believed that 2025 will be a year that happens once in every century and will have to face great challenges. Although crises and opportunities are hand in hand, not all leaders know how to “recognize change”, “respond to change” and “seek change”. Recently, Xia Baolong, the director of the Hong Kong and Macao work office and the Hong Kong and Macao affairs office with the Council of State, visited the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin, the cooperation zone and Technological and scientific innovation of Hetao Shenzhen-Hong Kong (Hetao Cooperation Zone), Modern Service Industry Zone between Qianhai district in Shenzhen and Hong Kong and the port of Yantian, where he was deeply involved in talks with employees responsible to strengthen cooperation between Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau and to promote the best integration of these cities in the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay. Hong Kong and Macao, in conjunction with Guangzhou and Shenzhen, were once seen as the four engines of the development of the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay. However, due to several factors, Hong Kong is still in the “transition from stability to prosperity” while “1+4” diversification in Macau is, for now, in an embryonic phase. If the Government of the MSAR cannot deal with cautious diversification, it will not be able to produce synergies in the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay, but, on the contrary, the status of Macao will endangered as a potential international financial center and as a center World Tourism and Leisure World. Therefore, director Xia is very concerned about the future development of Hong Kong and Macao. Since Sam Hou Fai took office as chief executive, it is believed that his habit of “streets” has been changed, becoming more complicated for him to learn about the difficulties that the local population faces every day, related to The lack of employment and the closure of stores due to the breach of consumption. In addition to the fall in property prices, the cost of living is constantly increasing and radio programs are often heard from people asking the social risk value and old age pension to be increased. The beautiful idea of ​​“integration of Macao and Hengqin” cannot improve the current living level of short -term Macao residents. In the next lines of governing governing for the financial year of 2025, I sincerely hope that the government is actually concerned with the issues with which citizens have to deal with daily. Sam Hou Fai passed from the judge of the last court, the Chief Executive, while Wu Sui moved as a magistrate to be a guardian deity of the popular tradition. However, both were confronted with the challenge of finding solutions to relieve the difficulties that people have to face.

item.title: Geogostronomy and the role of Portuguese cuisine in Macau
item.description: “Macau’s Food Culture is a fascinating amalgamation of flavors Brought together by centuries of trade and colonial Rule. The Portuguese influence is particularly evident in dishes that combine local ingredients with techniques and recipes brought from Portugal. ” Macau’s Culinary Delights: Portuguese and Chinese Fusion BARKER, Anthony The intersection between geography and gastronomy, designated by geogostronomy, illustrates the significant influence of the place on culinary practices. Macau's Portuguese cuisine encompasses a unique mixture of culinary traditions, innovative practices and cultural exchanges that evolved from Portuguese influences and local ingredients. At the heart of Macanese cuisine is its historical framing. The gastronomic identity of Macao emerges from historical ties with Portugal, especially from the mid -16th century. The Portuguese presence in Asia began a cultural and culinary exchange that led to the development of unique dishes. This connection has established a platform for the culinary exchange not only between Portuguese and Chinese kitchens, but also with flavors from other regions, such as India and Southeast Asia. Thus, the origins of Macanese cuisine can be attributed to this intercultural integration, shaped by the availability of local ingredients and the migration of peoples. The introduction of ingredients such as turmeric, chilli and potatoes transformed the local kitchen. Traditional Portuguese recipes were adapted to local tastes and available resources, thus creating a distinct culinary hybrid. During the period of colonization, the Portuguese in Macao established a vibrant commercial port, facilitating trade between Europe and Asia. This trade brought not only exotic ingredients, but also several culinary techniques that formed the backbone of Macau's cuisine. The mixture of flavors of Portuguese, Chinese and Asian influences contributed to the richness of Macao's culinary supply. Macau's cuisine scene has been shaped by several chefs that have been at the forefront of promoting traditional Portuguese dishes cast with local influences. Its approach exemplifies the culmination of Portuguese culinary traditions and local ingredients, resulting in innovative dishes that appeal to both locations and tourists. In addition, historians and gastronomic critics have played a crucial role in the documentation and promotion of the history of Portuguese cuisine in Macau. Its investigation provides valuable information on the evolution of culinary practices, helping to preserve heritage and ensure its future relevance. Geogostronomy analyzes the way geographical and cultural contexts shape food practices. In Macao, this perspective is evident in the cooking fusion that defines the region. Several traditional Portuguese dishes have been adapted using local spices, creating a unique version that reflects the identity of Macau and cannot be considered a copy or tampering. The influence of local spices and culinary techniques also led to the onset of macanese dishes, such as “Pork Chop Bun”, called the “Macanese version of the hamburger” and derived from “Bifana” and “African Chicken”, which is derived from the “Chicken to Piri Piri” that show the mixture of flavors and traditions. The role of spices in Macanese cuisine cannot be underestimated. The Portuguese settlers brought with them a wide variety of spices from their colonies, including black pepper, cinnamon and cloves. These flavors mingled with Chinese indigenous ingredients, giving rise to unique dishes that reflect both inheritances. For example, one of the most famous macanese dishes is Cod to Brás, a cod dish that integrates Portuguese techniques with local flavors such as garlic and onion. Another remarkable dish is the iconic Macaense Caril, which features Portuguese influences infused with spices that resemble Indian cuisine. The introduction of new cooking methods is an important aspect of this merger. Traditional Portuguese cuisine often involves techniques such as grilling, stewing and baking. These methods have been harmoniously mixed with Chinese methods, such as frying and steaming, creating a kitchen that is as diverse in preparation as in taste. Douts like the “Cabydela Duck”, a plate of duck in vinegar and served with rice, exemplify this mixture. The use of rice itself is noteworthy, as it is a basic food in both cultures, often prepared with techniques that enhance its flavor, such as frying with garlic before boiling. The adaptation of these dishes demonstrates the dynamic nature of culinary practices in response to geographical and cultural factors. The role of Portuguese cuisine goes beyond mere culinary practices; It plays a significant role in the formation of cultural identity and the economic development of Macao. The region's rich cooking supply has become a vital part of its tourist industry. Tourists looking for authentic experiences are often attracted to local restaurants that serve traditional Luso-Maca dishes, thus supporting companies and the economy. In addition, the culinary landscape gained international recognition, with Macao receiving the title of UNESCO gastronomy city on October 31, 2017. This designation underlines the importance of preserving culinary heritage, simultaneously promoting its cultural meaning and its innovation potential. Highlights the need for sustainable practices in tourism and gastronomy sectors, ensuring that Macao's unique flavors continue to prosper. In recent years, Macao's culinary scene has recorded significant changes due to Covid-19 pandemic, globalization and the alteration of consumer preferences. (continues)

item.title: Australia interdicts social networks to children under 16 (III)
item.description: In the last two weeks, we have been considering the Australian Senate's decision to approve the change to the 2024 Internet (minimum age for access to social networks) law on November 28, 2024, which interdicts access to Networks to children under 16. The contents of the new law are simple, but from an operational point of view, there are many issues that deserve to be discussed. The two main questions are as follows, in the first place, neither infrastructors nor their legal guardians are not penalized in the light of the new law, the penalty is only about companies that generate social networks. This approach can lead to disputes on the attribution of responsibility when put into practice. Secondly, the new law requires companies that generate social networks to take measures to verify the age of users. However, the new law clearly stipulates that users cannot carry in these platforms the identification documents, which makes the correct determination of their age difficult. A goal spokesman stated that Facebook respects Australian law, but is concerned about the process adopted, as it considers that the law was accelerated to ensure the interdiction of children's access to social networks without being heard to different opinions on the subject. Since currently there is no more effective method to prevent children from using social networks, to solve the problem, the Australian government has stated that it would adopt the “age certification system”. It is planned to invite 1,200 Australian citizens to take an age evaluation test, and a consulting firm will implement recommendations in the middle of this year. This will be one of the largest tests with age assessment technology ever performed. If successful, it will become an important reference indicator for legislative agencies and technological platforms around the world to detect the age of users of social networks. It will be a highly representative global model and will be congratulated. But if it fails, will Australia have an alternative plan to enforce the new law? Although not mentioned in the news, from the point of view of public administration, it would be complicated to have a completely new computer system of unknown effectiveness to deal with the social problems arising from the access of children under 16 to social networks, the which is undoubtedly a risk. If prepared for both scenarios Australia will be easier to implement the new law. When it is necessary to verify the age of the users, the most effective method is through the presentation of identity cards, passports, etc. In Australia this method is not legal, possibly because photos and identification data are personal information and involve privacy protection issues. When companies that generate social networks receive accurate information, they can correctly determine the age of users, but at the same time, as they have access to many data from users, they have to treat them carefully. In light of the new law, companies that generate social networks can avoid these problems because they will not have to process the personal data of users, and they do not need to worry about the possibility of their data being disclosed, stolen or sold by third parties . Moreover, in relation to the practical and operational aspects of the new law, there is another issue that is concerned with online game. The children under 16 are students of basic education. Young people in this age group have no self-control and self-preservation capacity yet and easily addicted to the online universe. They are very dependent on social networking platforms and online games. Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said that excessive use of social networks is a risk to the physical and mental health of children and that legislation should be introduced to control this risk. If Australia has passed legislation to protect the physical and mental health of children under 16, is the next step prevent them from playing online? On October 25, 2019, the management of the Press and Publications of Continental China issued the “National Press Administration Warning and Publications for Prevention of Addiction in Online Games among the Minors”, stipulating that all online game companies can only Have games available on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. These days, the games are available for one hour from 20.00 to 21.00, and no service will be available at other times. This regulation was actually applied in mainland China. On the other hand, South Korea passed a law in 2011 to restrict access from under 16 to online play between 22.30 and 6.00, but the law was very contested and was eventually repealed because it did not respect the rights of younger people . The new Australian law recognizes the risks that social networks pose for children's physical and mental health. If young people start using social networks too early, they are subject to adverse consequences such as depression, harassment, anxiety and weak academic results. If you continue to evolve into “internet addiction”, it will be even more serious and inevitable to legislate. The question of restricting children's access to online games can be seen as continuing the restriction of children's access to social networks and can be treated in the same way. The experience of mainland China in this area may be valuable to other countries. Hong Kong and Macao currently have no legislation that regulates access from under 16 to social networks or online game platforms. Do we need legislation to regulate these issues? The new Australian law is a warning to remind us of this problem. What should we do? Each of these regions can conduct an in -depth investigation and decide according to their conclusions. Next week we will have a new theme. item.title: Robert De Niro debuts on television on the conspiracy thriller “day zero”
item.description: The new miniseries "Day Zero" on Netflix marks the debut of Oscarized actor Robert de Niro on television, in a thriller in which he plays an former US president called to discover the authors of a devastating cyberthyrach. "The argument was so good, not even needed prior preparation," said the actor, at a press conference of the series in which Lusa participated. “The dialogue was excellent. It might have been pier, pretentious or biased, but in this case I wouldn't be here. ” “Day Zero” was filmed over seven months in New York, with Robert de Niro being critical to this location. "For some time I had spoken to my agent about doing anything in New York," said the actor, who is also a six -episode miniseries producer. The cast includes Angela Bassett, Matthew Modine, Jesse Plemons, Lizzy Caplan, Connie Britton and Joan Allen. Created by Eric Newman (“Griselda”, “Narcos: Mexico”), Noah Oppenheim (former president of NBC News) and Michael Schmidt (journalist), the miniseries departs from a massive cyberataque that turns off in the United States for a minute and causes chaos and thousands of dead. Robert De Niro plays former President George Mullen, called by current President Evelyn Mitchell (Angela Bassett) to preside over a committee to which unheard of investigation powers are given. The director Lesli Linka Glatter ("West Wing", "Homeland") described the series as "a paranoic conspiracy thriller." "The idea came from conversations about our relationship with the truth," said Eric Newman at the conference. "It's something global: we have entered a post-truth age where truths can be mutually exclusive." One of Mullen's antagonists is the author of a podcast, Evan Green (Dan Stevens) who plays with suspicions and throws accusations without proof to monetize the hearing's ultrasound. "Green represents the bangs that operates around a story like this," said the actor. "He is annoying, a divisive figure who thrives with division and makes it his coin." But the argument does not take a position and none of the interveners comes out particularly well, with a varied range of doubtful decisions, except for former President Sheila Mullen's wife, who maintains integrity. "What we hope that people will take this is that, although the mechanisms by which we determine the truth can be broken, perhaps irreparably, it is still possible to do the right thing," said Newman. "Although it is a disconcerting view of humanity, in the end there is a certain optimism and hope." Cocriador Noah Oppenheim said the team started working in this story several years ago and that it is amazing to see how what has happened in the real world mirrors the chaos that the series portrays. "If we think about the threats we face, be it cybership, climate change or nuclear war, the largest of all is the inability to agree with a shared set of facts," he said. Angela Bassett, who plays President Mitchell, stressed the importance of “seeing this representation of a woman” as the actress “in a place of power in the oval room”, something that excited her to do the series, besides being the second time to work with de niro. Also Connie Britton, who gives body to Valerie Whitesell, found the humanization of highly political situations interesting, which often forget that behind power positions are human beings with complex relationships and personalities. "This shows us how our choices can have an impact on everyone," he said while the characters try to maintain decorum and respect the high positions. "These acts of equilibrium are what we do in real life, even if we are not in high risk espionage or cybership," he continued. "We are all trying to find a balance between our responsibilities and intimate relationships."

item.title: Mud | Fire in the lake building causes two injured
item.description:
In addition to two hospitalized women, 18 people needed help to be removed from the building, although without injury. The fight against the flames was hampered by the wind, since several doors were open
Two women were transported yesterday to the Conde São Januário Hospital Center, following a fire in the Lake Building in Taipa. The case happened early in the morning, and in the afternoon, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the authorities suspected that the flames had originated in a short circuit of a television. The Fire Department (CB) was alerted to the emergency, around 7:46 am, at a time when images of fire circulated online in various social networking groups. According to CB's second commander, Lam Chon Sang initially, the authorities were warned for a 10th floor fire. However, on site, emergency response operations eventually took longer than expected, because the firefighters had to look for the flames, which were active on the 7th floor and not 10, as initially warned. According to Lam Chon Sang's statements, cited by the newspaper or Mun, rescue operations were also difficult for the damage caused in the service elevator, usually used by firefighters in case of fire, which forced the material to combat Flames was transported by the stairs. When they reached the firewalk in the corridor, the firefighters came across two inanimate women. The wounds, one 79 and another 51, were removed from the scene, transported to the hospital and were yesterday in serious condition. The two lived in the most affected housing by the flames. In addition to hospitalized women, rescue operations implied the removal of 18 other residents, who needed help to abandon the building. These people were on three other floors of the building, which were not directly affected by the flames, and none needed to receive medical treatments. Intense heat About the fight against the flames, Lam Chon Sang explained that the firefighters found a large fire inside the apartment where the fire has been suspected of having originated. As a consequence, the intense heat sense by the “peacekeepers” forced the extra efforts and more time than it would be expected. In addition, the fact that several doors in the building are open, contrary to what is normally advised, will have contributed to the flames to spread faster thanks to the wind. The second-commander of the CB also indicated as another of the main difficulties in fighting the fire the delay of about 15 minutes to connect the hoses to water supply. The flames were declared extinct around 08h55, but the aftermath phase lasted until 09h40. The apartment where everything will have started was very damaged, and there were two more dwellings, with smaller losses. In total 54 firefighters were mobilized for the fire, distributed by 12 emergency response vehicle. According to the Chinese channel of TDM, several residents of the Lake building complained that the fire alarm did not touch. On this aspect, the Fire Department has hypothesized that the sound was weak in some places further from the flames, since when they reached the building the alarm was playing. Accompanied the case Hours after the fire, the Institute of Social Action (IAS) issued a statement to indicate to be very attentive to the developments and referring to having asked traditional associations to engage in support operations. “The Institute of Social Action is very attentive to the fire that took place in the Lake Building, in Taipa. After becoming aware of the event, they were immediately sent to the social workers, accompanied by workers from various social work institutions at the Taipa, including the Community Center of the General Union of Macao Associations, the Taipa Lake Services Center of the Federation of Macao Workers' Associations and the Alegria Family Support Center in abundance of the General Association of Macao Women, with the aim of providing emotional support, advice and other necessary supports according to the needs of residents, ”was reported. According to the same source, despite the destruction in three dwellings, in the afternoon there were no residents needing “temporary accommodation” provided by IAS.
Associations in the Lake Building Minutes after the fire images began to circulate online, some of the traditional associations emerged on site to help people affected by the incident. Association employees, such as residents or women, also published on social networks photographs of the site and disclosed telephone contacts for those in need of assistance.

item.title: Taxis | Number of offenses tripled in January
item.description:
The latest data from the Public Security Police body have a reduction in road mortality, with the occurrence of zero cases in January, unlike taxi drivers who tripled against January 2024 numbers.
In January, the offenses committed by taxi drivers tripled to 187 occurrences, compared to the same period, according to the latest data published by the Public Security Police (CPSP). In January 2024, taxi drivers had committed 61 infringements. However, last month the offenses rose to 187, an increase of 206.56 percent. The main offense committed by taxi drivers in January this year was due to the lack of respect for the order of arrival in taxi squares. The fact that they surpassed other colleagues who had been in the squares longer led to a total of 126 offenses, a significant climb, given who in January last year had only been recorded four infractions of the genre. Throughout the first month of this year, authorities also identified other offenses, such as six cases of abusive price collection, an increase of four cases compared to the same period, 32 transport refusal situations, a growth of two cases, and nine Cases of “evident deviation of route”, a number of occurrences equal to that of January last year. As a result of the highest number of offenses, the number of cases reported to the Directorate of Services for Traffic Affairs (DSAT), which rose to 44, when in January 2024 had been 24. Fewer fines Although there are more offenses involving taxi drivers, there were fewer traffic offenses in January with a total of 60,415 infractions. In January last year, the number was 66,071 infringements, representing that in January 2025 there was a decrease of 8.56 percent. With less offenses, the amount embodied by the authorities with fines decreased. In January this year, the amount collected was 16.11 million patacas, a reduction of 6.68 percent compared to 17.27 million patacas registered in January 2024. A positive trend was also registered at the level of claims on local roads. Road accidents fell from 1,351 occurrences to 1,345 accidents. In none of the accidents there were deadly victims, which contrasts with January last year, when a woman lost her life on local roads. Less injured in local accidents were also registered, with a reduction of 3.44 percent of 465 injured to 449 injured. However, in a negative aspect, the number of pedestrian accidents grew 91.67 percent, from 36 accidents for 69 accidents. At the same time, the number of pawns committed by crossing the roads had a reduction of 67.68 percent, from 1751 occurrences to 566 occurrences.

item.title: Economy | Takeaway meals accelerate inflation
item.description:
Inflation accelerated in January for the first time in the last six months, according to official data. The increase in Takeaway meals prices was primarily responsible for the climb
Inflation accelerated in January, for the first time in half a year, especially due to the cost of meals acquired away from home, in a month that featured the start of the Lunar New Year, was announced on Friday. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) rose 0.57 percent in January, in annual terms, and increased 0.17 percent compared to December, according to official data released by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC ). January thus ended a period of five consecutive months of deceleration of inflation. In December, the IPC had increased 0.23 percent in annual terms and retreated 0.01 percent compared to November. December was the month when Macau was closer to falling into deflation (annual fall in consumer prices) since June 2021, when the city lived the last 10 consecutive months of deflation in the peak of the economic crisis caused by the pandemic. Deflation reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly severe, as a drop in the price of assets, as a rule contracted with credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. Everything avoided In a statement, DSEC justified the acceleration in January with a 0.88 percent rise in the sector of food products and non -alcoholic beverages. The Lunar New Year, the largest mass movement in the world, is the main traditional party of Chinese families and takes place in January or February, depending on the lunar calendar. This year, he celebrated between January 28 and February 4. The cost of meals acquired outside the home rose 1.7 percent. With the progressive recovery of tourism, Macau registered a 10.1 percent increase in the price of airplane tickets and a 17.4 percent growth in the cost of tours and hotel rooms abroad. With the increase in the number of visitors, the region recorded a 23.1 percent increase in the price of jewelry, watches and products made of gold. Apartments mortgages have risen 0.36 percent, although the housing price index fell 11.7 percent last year and Macau's monetary authority approved three interest rates in the last three months 2024. The Legislative Assembly approved, on 18 April, the end of several taxes on the acquisition of housing, to “increase liquidity” in the real estate market, defended the secretary for the economy and finance, Law Wai Nong. Official data also show that health services were 1.1 percent more expensive and the cost of insurance rose 2.47 percent.

item.title: Germany | Beijing expects “successful” cooperation after Merz's victory
item.description: China said yesterday that it expects to maintain a "successful cooperation" with Germany, after the conservative Friedrich Merz of the Democratic Union (CDU), and his Bavarian sister, the Social-Christian Union (CSU), overcome the general elections of Sunday. “China and Germany have had a strategic partnership for over 30 years. The partnership has been maintained based on mutual respect and equal treatment, reaching abundant progress, ”Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian told a press conference. Lin Jian said China expects Germany to play "a more important role in international affairs" and stressed that Beijing wants to work with Berlin to "contribute more efforts to world peace." The conservative bloc led by Friedrich Merz won the 28.6 percent German legislative elections of the votes, according to official data, and the alternative to Germany (AFD), the second force, the second force, with 20.8 percent. The Social Democrat (SPD) of the outgoing Chancellor Olaf Scholz won about 16.4 percent in Sunday's elections, while the Greens, a coalition partner, had about 11.6 percent of the votes. The left (Die Linke) reached about 8.8 percent, above 4.9 percent of 2012. Conservative leader Friedrich Merz will need partners to train government.

item.title: Alibaba will invest 50 mm in AI and cloud computing over the next three years
item.description: The Chinese giant of e -commerce Alibaba announced yesterday that he will invest 380 billion Yuan in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and cloud computing infrastructures. According to a statement widespread by the company through its News Portal Alizila, the announced amount exceeds the combined investment of the last decade in these two fields, identified by the group as strategic, along with the traditional electronic trade business. When presenting the results of the third fiscal quarter, on Friday, the group's CEO Eddie Wu revealed that the company intended to make “greater investment” in areas such as AI and cloud data services, although not had specified amounts. According to Alibaba, the measure "reinforces its commitment to long -term technological innovation" and "underlines the company's bet on AI -driven growth and its role as a leading [data services in] cloud." At the conference with analysts who followed the presentation of the results, Wu stated that AI is a “unique opportunity in a generation” and noted that achieving artificial general intelligence (AGI, a type of AI that would equal human intelligence) will be the main objective in the long run of the company. In his opinion, AI's ability to replicate human labor, both intellectual and physical, “could remodel” industries worldwide, leading “significant transformations” in economy and technology. The CEO recalled that a growing part of the AI-generated data will be processed and distributed through cloud networks, positioning Alibaba AI subsidiary, Alibaba Cloud, as "a key infrastructure supplier." Artificial future During the third tax quarter, the adjusted revenue from the cloud intelligence subsidiary increased by 11 percent over the previous year, while IMA revenue related to AI experienced its sixth consecutive three -digit growth quarter. In recent weeks, Alibaba has announced a pact to incorporate its QWEN model into Apple's iPhones in China, and there has been speculation that it may be interested in becoming investor at Deepseek, the AI ​​Chinese platform that shook the sector. “Looking to the future, the growth of revenues in the cloud intelligence division will continue to accelerate, driven by AI,” explained Wu, last Friday, in a message that accompanied the disclosure of the company's results, sent to the Bolsa de Hong Kong values, which exceeded analysts expectations. In the last quarter, Alibaba increased the volume of 8 percent and profits at 239 percent, in homologous terms.

item.title: CCP removes former aerospace company president by corruption
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) expelled Tan Ruisong, former president of state -owned Aviation Industry Corporation of China (AVIC), following the expansion of the ongoing anti -corruption campaign in the country to aerospace and military sectors. The Central Inspection and Disciplinary Commission (CCDI), the CCP's maximum anti -corruption body, said Tan “took sides with the military sector for his personal benefit” and has transformed his position into an instrument of illicit enrichment. The agency accused the former employee of accepting bribes and using his position to influence business restructuring and project contracts. The investigation revealed that the former president “lost his ideals and convictions, betrayed his original aspirations” and violated the CCP's internal regulations by “accepting inappropriate banquets”, “involving power exchanges for sex” and when using their position to “seek benefits for third parties in the restructuring of companies and hiring engineering projects”. Tan, who was secretary of the Communist Party at AVIC, is also accused of covering information on official investigations, giving illegally present and diverting large sums of public funds. Redoubled efforts Following its expulsion of the CCP, the case was sent to the judicial authorities, which may lead to a criminal proceedings. The announcement is part of the vast anti -corruption campaign launched by Chinese President Xi Jinping, after ascending to power in 2012, in which the senior employees were categorized as 'tigers' and bass status as 'flies'. The campaign has intensified in recent years, with almost 900,000 employees punished in 2024. The military sector became one of the investigators' leading focuses: CCP's leadership announced in December that it would “redouble their efforts” in a fight that resulted in the fall of army ministers and officers over the past year. XI stressed the need to reinforce discipline and fight corruption within the Popular Liberation Army (ELP), to ensure that the Armed Forces are "absolutely loyal, absolutely pure and absolutely reliable." The current campaign aims at civil servants, but also sectors as diverse as finances, tobacco and pharmacist products, among others, and follows to the launched in 2012, which was accompanied by greater repression, censorship and suspicions that the accusations make part of a maneuver to silence critics.

item.title: Ukraine | Xi tells Putin that he is "happy to see efforts" to end the war
item.description:
When three years of the beginning of the Ukraine invasion of Russia are marked, the Chinese administration reaffirms its commitment to the struggle to find a solution to the conflict. The Chinese president welcomed the new efforts to the US and Russia
Chinese President Xi Jinping told Russian homologist Vladimir Putin yesterday, who is happy to see that Russia and other countries are making "positive efforts" to end the war in Ukraine. "China is pleased to see that Russia and relevant parts are making positive efforts to end this crisis," Xi said in a telephone conversation, which takes place on the third anniversary of the Ukraine war. Quoted by the Official News Agency Xinhua, Xi also said that the ties between China and Russia have a “strong internal driving force” and a “unique strategic value”, and that the two countries are “two good neighbors” and “true friends ”, Which support each other in search of a“ common development ”. The Chinese leader added that the bilateral relationship “is not directed against third parties, nor will it be influenced by anyone”, stressing that ties will continue to develop “easily” and “will help mutual development, injecting stability and positive energy in international relations ”. According to Xinhua, Putin said he is committed to "eliminating the deep causes of conflict" between Russia and Ukraine in order to "achieve a sustainable and lasting peace solution." On the side of peace China said yesterday that it has always been “on the side of peace” and will continue to work to “build a consensus” that end the war in Ukraine, which has been going on for three years. "Since the beginning of this crisis, we have been working and maintaining communication with the parties involved, with the aim of building a consensus for peace," said Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian, in conference of the press. The spokesman added that China has always been "on the side of peace" and maintained a "just and objective" position, which has been "clear and consistent from the beginning." According to Chinese spokesmen, the Asian country hopes to “maintain communication with all parties involved” and will continue to “effort” to play “a constructive role” in resolving the conflict. Central position In recent weeks, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has said China's position on conflict has been “rational” and that Beijing wants to “establish a balanced, effective and sustainable security framework for Europe, aiming at a peace lasting ”. "China wants to work with all parties, including Europe," said Wang. Since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, China has maintained an ambiguous position on conflict, appealing to respect for the “territorial integrity of all countries”, including Ukraine, and attention by “legitimate concerns of all countries” reference to Russia. Beijing was opposed to "unilateral" sanctions against Moscow and called on "decancing and a political solution." However, the West accused China of supporting Russia's military campaign, something the Asian country has always denied. China has sent diplomatic representatives to the region and presented peace initiatives, such as the plan it elaborated with Brazil last year, which did not include the removal of Russian troops and was rejected by Kiev.

item.title: Macau and Angola will sign agreement to combat money laundering
item.description: Macao and Angola will sign an agreement to exchange information from forming money laundering and terrorism financing, the government announced yesterday. According to an order published yesterday in the official bulletin, the memorandum of understanding for the exchange of information regarding the combat of capital laundering, preceding crimes associated, funding for terrorism and financing the proliferation of weapons of massive destruction will be signed with the unit of Financial Information of the Republic of Angola. According to the order, signed by the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, on February 14, the Secretary for Security, Wong Sio Chak, can delegate this mission to the Commander General of Unit Police Services (SPU), Leong Man Cheong. The Macao Information Office (GIF), responsible for combating capital bleaching, financing to terrorism and proliferation of weapons of massive destruction, is under the protection of SPU. In March 2022, an annual US State Department report designated Macao as one of the main points of worldwide capital bleaching. According to the annual GIF report, Macao became in 2019 the only member of the Asia Pacific group against the laundering of capital (Gafi) that fulfilled “all 40 international standards” on the prevention of money laundering, terrorism financing and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. In the Gafi list Angola was added to the Gafafi 'gray list' in 2024, after falling short of his legal and financial regulation regimes. Gafi, an intergovernmental organization, establishes international standards in the field of struggle of capital laundering, the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of massive destruction. The 'gray list' identifies countries that are actively working with Gafafi to resolve strategic deficiencies in these areas. The GIF signed agreements for the exchange of information with 33 countries and territories, including the Portuguese Judicial Police Financial Information Unit, in 2008, the Central Bank of Timor-Leste Financial Information Unit in 2018 and in 2019 , the Brazilian Financial Activities Control Council and the Cape Verde Financial Information Unit.

item.title: China accuses Australia of exaggerating military maneuvers
item.description: The Chinese government yesterday accused Australia of “intentionally exaggerating” by addressing the military exercises performed by Beijing in international waters near the oceanic country. The three Chinese war ships involved in the operation “performed exercises in international waters, away from the Australian coast,” reads a statement published on the Chinese Weibo social network by the spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of Defense Wu Qian. “During this period, China organized royal fire exercises with war ships, having issued repeated security notices in advance. China's actions fully respected international law and common international practice without affecting the safety of air navigation, ”he said. The statements of the Australian government, which criticized the lack of transparency of the Chinese army in relation to the exercises "do not correspond to all the facts," he said. “Australia, fully aware of these facts, made unfounded accusations against China and intentionally exaggerated the situation. We are deeply shocked and extremely dissatisfied, ”said Wu. The spokesman asked Camberra to address bilateral and military relations “with an objective and rational attitude, showing more sincerity and professionalism, and taking concrete measures to promote the stable development of relations between the two countries and armies”. Finger appointed Australia's defense force accused Beijing Friday of being exercises with real fire without prior notice at the Tasmania Sea, between Australia and New Zealand, forcing the diversion of airlines. A day later, New Zealand Defense Minister Judith Collins said the Chinese had conducted a new job of royal fire exercises in the area. Australia told EFE agency on Thursday, which coordinated with regional partners, including New Zealand, response to this China's action, which usually performs similar exercises in water closer to Chinese territory and which are the subject of disputes with neighboring countries, including the Philippines. Beijing claims almost the entire Southern Sea of ​​China, rich in resources and a key point for world trade. In recent years, the influence on the southern Pacific islands has increased, historically associated with Australia and New Zealand, US partners.

item.title: Africa CDC | China and South Korea give 4 million to compensate for the USA
item.description: China and South Korea sent $ 4 million to the African Disease Prevention and Disease Control Center (Africa CDC), this entity announced Friday after the United States cut off the value of their help. Funding of $ four million, about 3.8 million euros, was reported by the Bloomberg Financial Information Agency, which explained that the continent receives 84 percent from health care financing from outside the region, including the 500 millions of dollars that the United States had committed and deliver. The US reduced help to $ 385 million, about 378 million euros, leaving the African public health agency with a $ 115 million deficit, almost 110 million euros, said director general, Jean Kaseya. The four million dollars advanced by China and South Korea are a consequence and the first response to the freezing of US foreign aid. At the end of January, US President Donald Trump gave his mind to freeze his country's external help, piped mainly through USAID, an organization of which he also ordered the dismissal of most of his employees worldwide. The decision caused panic among humanitarian organizations around the world that depend on US contracts to continue to function. However, on February 13, a federal judge temporarily blocked the Order of Trump to freeze US foreign aid, while another court suspended USAID dismantling.

item.title: Lunar New Year | Estimates point to more than nine billion trips
item.description: China estimates that about 9.03 billion domestic trips during the New Year Lunar, an increase of 7 percent compared to the same period of 2024, the Xinhua news agency said yesterday. Considered the largest annual movement of people in the country, this 40 -day period, known as 'Chunyun', began on January 14 and ended on February 22, although the largest peak of travel was recorded between January 28 and 04 February. According to official estimates, most trips were made by road (about 8.39 billion), far above those of train (513.63 million), air (90.19 million) and sea (31, 31 million) 15 million). The Asian country exceeded 8.4 billion interregional trips during the 2024 Chunyun, although Beijing's predictions for this year to exceed nine billion. The value was not reached due to bad weather, which caused delays and cancellations in the transport service and infrastructure problems in various regions. On January 29, millions of Chinese welcomed the serpent's year and, for a week, the country stopped to fulfill traditions such as cleaning houses deep, hanging paper cutouts to attract good luck, decorating the streets and Perform large family banquets.

item.title: Gavekal Dragonomics | Anti-corruption campaign intensifies, says "Think Tank"
item.description: The anti-corruption campaign in China is intensifying and threatens to paralyze the Chinese bureaucracy, pointed out a reflection group, at a time when Beijing demands employees to relaunch economic growth. Launched more than a decade ago by Chinese President Xi Jinping, the campaign reached a record number of 889,000 regime staff, according to data released by the Central Inspection and Disciplinary Commission - Maximum Anti -Corruption Organ of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP). This number represents an increase of almost 50 percent compared to the annual average of about 600,000 between 2018 and 2023. The 'Think Tank' Gavekal Dragonomics has predicted that the number will continue to grow, highlighting the widening of scrutiny to new sectors, such as finance, energy, health and infrastructure, as well as for lower levels of public administration, including CCP employees in villages, beyond provincial and municipal levels.
